intro: Chamaesyce anegadensis, commonly known as the Anegada sandmat, is a flowering plant native to the British Virgin Islands. It is a low-growing, mat-forming herb that thrives in sandy, coastal environments. The plant features small, green, ovate leaves with a hairy texture, and it produces tiny, inconspicuous yellow flowers. It is adapted to withstand salt spray and arid conditions, making it a hardy species of the coastal ecosystem. Chamaesyce anegadensis plays a role in stabilizing sand dunes and providing habitat for local invertebrates.
